name: src/core/Disposable.js
Disposable

The Disposable contract.

Implemented by objects that can free internal resources.

name: src/core/EffectComposer.js
EffectComposer
description:
The EffectComposer may be used in place of a normal WebGLRenderer.

The auto clear behaviour of the provided renderer will be disabled to prevent unnecessary clear operations.

It is common practice to use a {@link RenderPass} as the first pass to automatically clear the buffers and render a
scene for further processing.

params.name: renderer
params.description: The renderer that should be used.

params.name: options.depthBuffer
params.description: Whether the main render targets should have a depth buffer.

params.name: options.stencilBuffer
params.description: Whether the main render targets should have a stencil buffer.

params.name: options.alpha
params.description: Deprecated. Buffers are always RGBA since three r137.

params.name: options.multisampling
params.description: The number of samples used for multisample antialiasing. Requires WebGL 2.

params.name: options.frameBufferType
params.description: The type of the internal frame buffers. It's recommended to use HalfFloatType if possible.

name: inputBuffer
description:
The input buffer.

Two identical buffers are used to avoid reading from and writing to the same render target.

name: copyPass
description: A copy pass used for copying masked scenes.

name: autoRenderToScreen
description: Determines whether the last pass automatically renders to screen.

name: multisampling
description: The current amount of samples used for multisample anti-aliasing.

name: multisampling
description:
Sets the amount of MSAA samples.

Requires WebGL 2. Set to zero to disable multisampling.

name: replaceRenderer
description:
Replaces the current renderer with the given one.

The auto clear mechanism of the provided renderer will be disabled. If the new render size differs from the
previous one, all passes will be updated.

By default, the DOM element of the current renderer will automatically be removed from its parent node and the DOM
element of the new renderer will take its place.

params.name: updateDOM
params.description: Indicates whether the old canvas should be replaced by the new one in the DOM.

name: createDepthTexture
description:
Creates a depth texture attachment that will be provided to all passes.

Note: When a shader reads from a depth texture and writes to a render target that uses the same depth texture
attachment, the depth information will be lost. This happens even if `depthWrite` is disabled.

name: createBuffer
deprecated: Create buffers manually via WebGLRenderTarget instead.

params.name: depthBuffer
params.description: Whether the render target should have a depth buffer.

params.name: stencilBuffer
params.description: Whether the render target should have a stencil buffer.

params.name: multisampling
params.description: The number of samples to use for antialiasing.

return.description: A new render target that equals the renderer's canvas.

name: setMainScene
description: Can be used to change the main scene for all registered passes and effects.

name: setMainCamera
description: Can be used to change the main camera for all registered passes and effects.

name: addPass
description: Adds a pass, optionally at a specific index.

params.name: index
params.description: An index at which the pass should be inserted.

name: render
description: Renders all enabled passes in the order in which they were added.

params.name: deltaTime
params.description: The time since the last frame in seconds.

name: setSize
description: Sets the size of the buffers, passes and the renderer.

params.name: updateStyle
params.description: Determines whether the style of the canvas should be updated.

name: reset
description: Resets this composer by deleting all passes and creating new buffers.

name: dispose
description: Disposes this composer and all passes.

name: src/core/GaussKernel.js

Uses Pascal's Triangle to generate coefficients in the expansion of any binomial expression.

For details see https://mathworld.wolfram.com/PascalsTriangle.html.

return.description: The integer coefficients stored as doubles.

params.description: The kernel size. Should be an odd number in the range [3, 1020].

params.name: edgeBias
params.description: Determines how many edge coefficients should be cut off for increased accuracy.

name: steps
description: The number of steps for discrete sampling.

name: linearSteps
description: The number of steps for linear sampling.

params.name: edgeBias
params.description: The amount of edge coefficients to ignore.

name: src/core/Initializable.js
content:
/**
 * The initializable contract.
 *
 * Implemented by objects that can be initialized.
 *
 * @interface
 */

export class Initializable {

	/**
	 * Performs initialization tasks.
	 *
	 * @param {WebGLRenderer} renderer - A renderer.
	 * @param {Boolean} alpha - Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel.
	 * @param {Number} frameBufferType - The type of the main frame buffers.
	 */

	initialize(renderer, alpha, frameBufferType) {}

}

name: Initializable
description:
The initializable contract.

Implemented by objects that can be initialized.

params.name: alpha
params.description: Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel.

params.name: frameBufferType
params.description: The type of the main frame buffers.

name: src/core/OverrideMaterialManager.js
workaroundEnabled
description: A flag that indicates whether the override material workaround is enabled.

name: OverrideMaterialManager
description:
An override material manager.

Includes a workaround that fixes override materials for skinned meshes and instancing. Doesn't fix uniforms such as
normal maps and displacement maps. Using the workaround may have a negative impact on performance if the scene
contains a lot of meshes.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new override material manager.

name: materials
description: Override materials for meshes with front side triangles.

name: materialsBackSide
description: Override materials for meshes with back side triangles.

name: materialsDoubleSide
description: Override materials for meshes with double sided triangles.

name: materialsFlatShaded
description: Override materials for flat shaded meshes with front side triangles.

name: materialsFlatShadedBackSide
description: Override materials for flat shaded meshes with back side triangles.

name: materialsFlatShadedDoubleSide
description: Override materials for flat shaded meshes with double sided triangles.

name: replaceMaterial
description: Assigns an appropriate override material to a given mesh.

name: render
description: Renders the scene with the override material.

name: workaroundEnabled
description: Indicates whether the override material workaround is enabled.

name: workaroundEnabled
description:
Enables or disables the override material workaround globally.

This only affects post processing passes and effects.

name: src/core/Resolution.js
constructor
description:
Constructs a new resolution.

TODO Remove resizable param.

name: resizable
deprecated: Use an event listener for "change" events instead.

name: width
description:
The effective width.

If the preferred width and height are set to {@link Resizer.AUTO_SIZE}, the base width will be returned.

name: height
description:
The effective height.

If the preferred width and height are set to {@link Resizer.AUTO_SIZE}, the base height will be returned.

name: getWidth
description:
Returns the effective width.

If the preferred width and height are set to {@link Resizer.AUTO_SIZE}, the base width will be returned.

name: getHeight
description:
Returns the effective height.

If the preferred width and height are set to {@link Resizer.AUTO_SIZE}, the base height will be returned.

name: setScale
description:
Sets the resolution scale.

Also sets the preferred resolution to {@link Resizer.AUTO_SIZE}.

name: setPreferredWidth
description:
Sets the preferred width.

Use {@link Resizer.AUTO_SIZE} to automatically calculate the width based on the height and aspect ratio.

name: setPreferredHeight
description:
Sets the preferred height.

Use {@link Resizer.AUTO_SIZE} to automatically calculate the height based on the width and aspect ratio.

name: AUTO_SIZE
description:
An auto sizing constant.

Can be used to automatically calculate the width or height based on the original aspect ratio.

name: src/core/Selection.js
Selection
description:
An object selection.

Object selections use render layers to facilitate quick and efficient visibility changes.

params.name: iterable
params.description: A collection of objects that should be added to this selection.

params.name: layer
params.description: A dedicated render layer for selected objects. Range is `[2, 31]`. Starts at 2 if omitted.

name: exclusive
description: Controls whether objects that are added to this selection should be removed from all other layers.

name: _layer
description: The current render layer for selected objects.

name: layer
description: The render layer for selected objects.

name: getLayer
description:
Returns the current render layer for selected objects.

The default layer is 2. If this collides with your own custom layers, please change it before rendering!

name: setLayer
description:
Sets the render layer for selected objects.

The current selection will be updated accordingly.

name: isExclusive
description: Indicates whether objects that are added to this selection will be removed from all other layers.

return.description: Whether this selection is exclusive. Default is false.

name: setExclusive
description: Controls whether objects that are added to this selection should be removed from all other layers.

params.name: value
params.description: Whether this selection should be exclusive.

name: set
description: Clears this selection and adds the given objects.

params.name: objects
params.description: The objects that should be selected.

return.description: Returns 0 if the given object is currently selected, or -1 otherwise.

name: add
description:
Adds an object to this selection.

If {@link exclusive} is set to `true`, the object will also be removed from all other layers.

params.name: object
params.description: The object that should be selected.

name: delete
description: Removes an object from this selection.

params.name: object
params.description: The object that should be deselected.

return.description: Returns true if an object has successfully been removed from this selection; otherwise false.

name: toggle
description: Removes an existing object from the selection. If the object doesn't exist it's added instead.

return.description: Returns true if the object is added, false otherwise.

name: setVisible
description:
Sets the visibility of all selected objects.

This method enables or disables render layer 0 of all selected objects.

params.name: visible
params.description: Whether the selected objects should be visible.

name: src/core/Timer.js
Timer
description:
A timer.

Original implementation by Michael Herzog (Mugen87).

name: _delta
description: The most recent delta time in milliseconds.

name: _elapsed
description: The total elapsed time in milliseconds.

name: _fixedDelta
description: The fixed time step in milliseconds. Default is 16.667 (60 fps).

name: useFixedDelta
description: Determines whether this timer should use a fixed time step.

name: autoReset
description:
Enables or disables auto reset based on page visibility.

If enabled, the timer will be reset when the page becomes visible. This effectively pauses the timer when the page
is hidden. Has no effect if the API is not supported.

name: src/effects/Effect.js
Effect
description:
An abstract effect.

Effects can be combined using the {@link EffectPass}.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of this effect. Doesn't have to be unique.

params.name: fragmentShader
params.description: The fragment shader. This shader is required.

params.name: options.attributes
params.description: The effect attributes that determine the execution priority and resource requirements.

params.name: options.blendFunction
params.description: The blend function of this effect.

params.name: options.defines
params.description: Custom preprocessor macro definitions. Keys are names and values are code.

params.name: options.uniforms
params.description: Custom shader uniforms. Keys are names and values are uniforms.

params.name: options.vertexShader
params.description: The vertex shader. Most effects don't need one.

name: defines
description:
Preprocessor macro definitions.

Call {@link Effect.setChanged} after changing macro definitions.

name: uniforms
description:
Shader uniforms.

Call {@link Effect.setChanged} after adding or removing uniforms.

name: extensions
description:
WebGL extensions that are required by this effect.

Call {@link Effect.setChanged} after adding or removing extensions.

name: blendMode
description: The blend mode of this effect.

name: outputColorSpace
description:
The output color space.

Should only be changed if this effect converts the input colors to a different color space.

name: getName
description: Returns the name of this effect.

name: getUniforms
description: Returns the uniforms of this effect.

name: getExtensions
description: Returns the WebGL extensions that are required by this effect.

name: getBlendMode
description:
Returns the blend mode.

The result of this effect will be blended with the result of the previous effect using this blend mode.

name: setAttributes
description:
Sets the effect attributes.

Effects that have the same attributes will be executed in the order in which they were registered. Some attributes
imply a higher priority.

name: setChanged
description:
Informs the associated {@link EffectPass} that this effect requires a shader recompilation.

Should be called after changing macros or extensions and after adding/removing uniforms.

name: setDepthTexture
description:
Sets the depth texture.

You may override this method if your effect requires direct access to the depth texture that is bound to the
associated {@link EffectPass}.

name: update
description:
Updates this effect by performing supporting operations.

This method is called by the {@link EffectPass} right before the main fullscreen render operation, even if the
blend function is set to `SKIP`.

You may override this method if you need to update custom uniforms or render additional off-screen textures.

params.name: inputBuffer
params.description: A frame buffer that contains the result of the previous pass.

params.name: deltaTime
params.description: The time between the last frame and the current one in seconds.

name: setSize
description:
Updates the size of this effect.

You may override this method if you want to be informed about the size of the backbuffer/canvas.
This method is called before {@link initialize} and every time the size of the {@link EffectComposer} changes.

name: initialize
description:
Performs initialization tasks.

This method is called when the associated {@link EffectPass} is added to an {@link EffectComposer}.

params.name: alpha
params.description: Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

params.name: frameBufferType
params.description: The type of the main frame buffers.

name: dispose
description:
Performs a shallow search for properties that define a dispose method and deletes them.

The {@link EffectComposer} calls this method when it is being destroyed.

name: src/effects/index.js
src/enums/BlendFunction.js
content:
/**
 * A blend function enumeration.
 *
 * Important: Do not use `BlendFunction.SKIP` to disable effects. See
 * [Enabling and Disabling Effects](https://github.com/vanruesc/postprocessing/wiki/Enabling-and-Disabling-Effects)
 * for more information.
 *
 * Based on https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL/extensions/NV/NV_blend_equation_advanced.txt
 *
 * @type {Object}
 * @property {Number} SKIP - Deprecated. Use DST instead. Warning: This blend function does NOT fully disable the effect.
 * @property {Number} SET - Deprecated. Use SRC instead.
 * @property {Number} ADD - Additive blending. Supports HDR.
 * @property {Number} ALPHA - Alpha blending. Blends based on the alpha value of the new color. Supports HDR.
 * @property {Number} AVERAGE - Calculates the avarage of the new color and the base color. Supports HDR.
 * @property {Number} COLOR - Converts the colors to HSL and blends based on color.
 * @property {Number} COLOR_BURN - Color burn.
 * @property {Number} COLOR_DODGE - Color dodge.
 * @property {Number} DARKEN - Prioritize darker colors. Supports HDR.
 * @property {Number} DIFFERENCE - Color difference. Supports HDR.
 * @property {Number} DIVIDE - Color division. Supports HDR.
 * @property {Number} DST - Overwrites the new color with the base color while ignoring opacity. Supports HDR.
 * @property {Number} EXCLUSION - Color exclusion.
 * @property {Number} HARD_LIGHT - Hard light.
 * @property {Number} HARD_MIX - Hard mix.
 * @property {Number} HUE - Converts the colors to HSL and blends based on hue.
 * @property {Number} INVERT - Overwrites the base color with the inverted new color.
 * @property {Number} INVERT_RGB - Multiplies the new color with the inverted base color.
 * @property {Number} LIGHTEN - Prioritize lighter colors. Supports HDR.
 * @property {Number} LINEAR_BURN - Linear burn.
 * @property {Number} LINEAR_DODGE - Same as ADD but limits the result to 1.
 * @property {Number} LINEAR_LIGHT - Linear light.
 * @property {Number} LUMINOSITY - Converts the colors to HSL and blends based on luminosity.
 * @property {Number} MULTIPLY - Color multiplication. Supports HDR.
 * @property {Number} NEGATION - Negates the base color using the new color.
 * @property {Number} NORMAL - Overwrites the base color with the new one. Supports HDR.
 * @property {Number} OVERLAY - Color overlay.
 * @property {Number} PIN_LIGHT - Pin light.
 * @property {Number} REFLECT - Color reflection.
 * @property {Number} SCREEN - Screen blending. The two colors are effectively projected on a white screen simultaneously.
 * @property {Number} SRC - Overwrites the base color with the new one while ignoring opacity. Supports HDR.
 * @property {Number} SATURATION - Converts the colors to HSL and blends based on saturation.
 * @property {Number} SOFT_LIGHT - Soft light.
 * @property {Number} SUBTRACT - Subtracts the new color from the base color.
 * @property {Number} VIVID_LIGHT - Vivid light.
 */

export const BlendFunction = {
	SKIP: 9,
	SET: 30,
	ADD: 0,
	ALPHA: 1,
	AVERAGE: 2,
	COLOR: 3,
	COLOR_BURN: 4,
	COLOR_DODGE: 5,
	DARKEN: 6,
	DIFFERENCE: 7,
	DIVIDE: 8,
	DST: 9,
	EXCLUSION: 10,
	HARD_LIGHT: 11,
	HARD_MIX: 12,
	HUE: 13,
	INVERT: 14,
	INVERT_RGB: 15,
	LIGHTEN: 16,
	LINEAR_BURN: 17,
	LINEAR_DODGE: 18,
	LINEAR_LIGHT: 19,
	LUMINOSITY: 20,
	MULTIPLY: 21,
	NEGATION: 22,
	NORMAL: 23,
	OVERLAY: 24,
	PIN_LIGHT: 25,
	REFLECT: 26,
	SATURATION: 27,
	SCREEN: 28,
	SOFT_LIGHT: 29,
	SRC: 30,
	SUBTRACT: 31,
	VIVID_LIGHT: 32
};

/**
 * An enumeration of effect shader placeholders.
 *
 * @type {Object}
 * @property {String} FRAGMENT_HEAD - A placeholder for function and variable declarations in the fragment shader.
 * @property {String} FRAGMENT_MAIN_UV - A placeholder for UV transformations in the fragment shader.
 * @property {String} FRAGMENT_MAIN_IMAGE - A placeholder for color calculations in the fragment shader.
 * @property {String} VERTEX_HEAD - A placeholder for function and variable declarations in the vertex shader.
 * @property {String} VERTEX_MAIN_SUPPORT - A placeholder for supporting calculations in the vertex shader.
 */

export const EffectShaderSection = {
	FRAGMENT_HEAD: "FRAGMENT_HEAD",
	FRAGMENT_MAIN_UV: "FRAGMENT_MAIN_UV",
	FRAGMENT_MAIN_IMAGE: "FRAGMENT_MAIN_IMAGE",
	VERTEX_HEAD: "VERTEX_HEAD",
	VERTEX_MAIN_SUPPORT: "VERTEX_MAIN_SUPPORT"
};

content:
/**
 * An enumeration of blur kernel sizes.
 *
 * @type {Object}
 * @property {Number} VERY_SMALL - A very small kernel that matches a 7x7 Gaussian blur kernel.
 * @property {Number} SMALL - A small kernel that matches a 25x25 Gaussian blur kernel.
 * @property {Number} MEDIUM - A medium sized kernel that matches a 63x63 Gaussian blur kernel.
 * @property {Number} LARGE - A large kernel that matches a 127x127 Gaussian blur kernel.
 * @property {Number} VERY_LARGE - A very large kernel that matches a 391x391 Gaussian blur kernel.
 * @property {Number} HUGE - A huge kernel that cannot be replicated with a single Gaussian blur pass.
 */

export const KernelSize = {
	VERY_SMALL: 0,
	SMALL: 1,
	MEDIUM: 2,
	LARGE: 3,
	VERY_LARGE: 4,
	HUGE: 5
};

name: src/enums/ToneMappingMode.js
content:
/**
 * A tone mapping mode enumeration.
 *
 * @type {Object}
 * @property {Number} LINEAR - No tone mapping, only exposure.
 * @property {Number} REINHARD - Simple Reinhard tone mapping.
 * @property {Number} REINHARD2 - Modified Reinhard tone mapping.
 * @property {Number} REINHARD2_ADAPTIVE - Simulates the optic nerve responding to the amount of light it is receiving.
 * @property {Number} UNCHARTED2 - Uncharted 2 tone mapping. http://filmicworlds.com/blog/filmic-tonemapping-operators.
 * @property {Number} OPTIMIZED_CINEON - Deprecated. Use `CINEON` instead.
 * @property {Number} CINEON - Optimized filmic operator by Jim Hejl and Richard Burgess-Dawson. Requires three r168 or higher.
 * @property {Number} ACES_FILMIC - ACES tone mapping with a scale of 1.0/0.6.
 * @property {Number} AGX - Filmic tone mapping. Requires three r160 or higher. https://github.com/EaryChow/AgX.
 * @property {Number} NEUTRAL - Neutral tone mapping by Khronos. Requires three r162 or higher. https://modelviewer.dev/examples/tone-mapping.
 */

export const ToneMappingMode = {
	LINEAR: 0,
	REINHARD: 1,
	REINHARD2: 2,
	REINHARD2_ADAPTIVE: 3,
	UNCHARTED2: 4,
	OPTIMIZED_CINEON: 5,
	CINEON: 5,
	ACES_FILMIC: 6,
	AGX: 7,
	NEUTRAL: 8
};

properties.name: LINEAR
properties.description: No tone mapping, only exposure.

properties.name: REINHARD
properties.description: Simple Reinhard tone mapping.

properties.name: REINHARD2
properties.description: Modified Reinhard tone mapping.

properties.name: REINHARD2_ADAPTIVE
properties.description: Simulates the optic nerve responding to the amount of light it is receiving.

properties.name: UNCHARTED2
properties.description: Uncharted 2 tone mapping. http://filmicworlds.com/blog/filmic-tonemapping-operators.

properties.name: OPTIMIZED_CINEON
properties.description: Deprecated. Use `CINEON` instead.

properties.name: CINEON
properties.description: Optimized filmic operator by Jim Hejl and Richard Burgess-Dawson. Requires three r168 or higher.

properties.name: ACES_FILMIC
properties.description: ACES tone mapping with a scale of 1.0/0.6.

properties.name: AGX
properties.description: Filmic tone mapping. Requires three r160 or higher. https://github.com/EaryChow/AgX.

properties.name: NEUTRAL
properties.description: Neutral tone mapping by Khronos. Requires three r162 or higher. https://modelviewer.dev/examples/tone-mapping.

name: src/materials/EdgeDetectionMaterial.js
EdgeDetectionMaterial
description: An edge detection material. Mainly used for SMAA.

name: constructor
description:
Constructs a new edge detection material.

TODO Remove parameters.

name: localContrastAdaptationFactor
description:
The local contrast adaptation factor. Has no effect if the edge detection mode is set to DEPTH. Default is 2.0.

If a neighbor edge has _factor_ times bigger contrast than the current edge, the edge will be discarded.

This allows to eliminate spurious crossing edges and is based on the fact that if there is too much contrast in a
direction, the perceptual contrast in the other neighbors will be hidden.

name: getLocalContrastAdaptationFactor
description: Returns the local contrast adaptation factor.

name: setLocalContrastAdaptationFactor
description: Sets the local contrast adaptation factor. Has no effect if the edge detection mode is set to DEPTH.

params.name: value
params.description: The local contrast adaptation factor. Default is 2.0.

name: edgeDetectionThreshold
description:
The edge detection threshold. Range: [0.0, 0.5].

A lower value results in more edges being detected at the expense of performance.

For luma- and chroma-based edge detection, 0.1 is a reasonable value and allows to catch most visible edges. 0.05
is a rather overkill value that allows to catch 'em all. Darker scenes may require an even lower threshold.

If depth-based edge detection is used, the threshold will depend on the scene depth.

name: predicationMode
description:
The predication mode.

Predicated thresholding allows to better preserve texture details and to improve edge detection using an additional
buffer such as a light accumulation or depth buffer.

name: predicationScale
description:
The predication scale. Range: [1.0, 5.0].

Determines how much the edge detection threshold should be scaled when using predication.

name: predicationStrength
description:
The predication strength. Range: [0.0, 1.0].

Determines how much the edge detection threshold should be decreased locally when using predication.

name: src/materials/LuminanceMaterial.js
LuminanceMaterial
description:
A luminance shader material.

This shader produces a greyscale luminance map that describes the absolute amount of light emitted by a scene. It can
also be configured to output colors that are scaled with their respective luminance value. Additionally, a range may
be provided to mask out undesired texels.

The alpha channel always contains the luminance value.

On luminance coefficients:
 http://www.poynton.com/notes/colour_and_gamma/ColorFAQ.html#RTFToC9

Coefficients for different color spaces:
 https://hsto.org/getpro/habr/post_images/2ab/69d/084/2ab69d084f9a597e032624bcd74d57a7.png

Luminance range reference:
 https://cycling74.com/2007/05/23/your-first-shader/#.Vty9FfkrL4Z

name: orthogonalSearchSteps
description:
The maximum amount of steps performed in the horizontal/vertical pattern searches, at each side of the pixel.
Range: [0, 112].

In number of pixels, it's actually the double. So the maximum line length perfectly handled by, for example 16, is
64 (perfectly means that longer lines won't look as good, but are still antialiased).

name: setOrthogonalSearchSteps
description: Sets the maximum amount of steps performed in the horizontal/vertical pattern searches, at each side of the pixel.

name: diagonalSearchSteps
description:
The maximum steps performed in the diagonal pattern searches, at each side of the pixel. This search
jumps one pixel at a time. Range: [0, 20].

On high-end machines this search is cheap (between 0.8x and 0.9x slower for 16 steps), but it can have a
significant impact on older machines.

name: src/passes/Pass.js
Pass
description:
An abstract pass.

Fullscreen passes use a shared fullscreen triangle:
https://michaldrobot.com/2014/04/01/gcn-execution-patterns-in-full-screen-passes/

name: fullscreenGeometry
description:
A shared fullscreen triangle.

The screen size is 2x2 units (NDC). A triangle needs to be 4x4 units to fill the screen.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of this pass. Does not have to be unique.

params.name: scene
params.description: The scene to render. The default scene contains a single mesh that fills the screen.

params.name: camera
params.description: A camera. Fullscreen effect passes don't require a camera.

name: screen
description: A mesh that fills the screen.

name: rtt
description: Indicates whether this pass should render to texture.

name: needsSwap
description:
Only relevant for subclassing.

Indicates whether the {@link EffectComposer} should swap the frame buffers after this pass has finished
rendering. Set this to `false` if this pass doesn't render to the output buffer or the screen. Otherwise, the
contents of the input buffer will be lost.

name: needsDepthTexture
description:
Only relevant for subclassing.

Indicates whether the {@link EffectComposer} should prepare a depth texture for this pass.
Set this to `true` if this pass relies on depth information from a preceding {@link RenderPass}.

name: enabled
description: Indicates whether this pass is enabled.

name: renderToScreen
description:
Sets the render to screen flag.

If this flag is changed, the fullscreen material will be updated as well.

name: isEnabled
description: Indicates whether this pass is enabled.

params.name: value
params.description: Whether the pass should be enabled.

return.description: The current fullscreen material, or null if there is none.
The current depth texture, or null if there is none.

name: setDepthTexture
description:
Sets the depth texture.

This method will be called automatically by the {@link EffectComposer}.
You may override this method if your pass relies on the depth information of a preceding {@link RenderPass}.

name: render
description:
Renders this pass.

This is an abstract method that must be overridden.

params.name: inputBuffer
params.description: A frame buffer that contains the result of the previous pass.

params.name: outputBuffer
params.description: A frame buffer that serves as the output render target unless this pass renders to screen.

params.name: deltaTime
params.description: The time between the last frame and the current one in seconds.

params.name: stencilTest
params.description: Indicates whether a stencil mask is active.

throws.description: An error is thrown if the method is not overridden.

name: setSize
description:
Sets the size.

You may override this method if you want to be informed about the size of the backbuffer/canvas.
This method is called before {@link initialize} and every time the size of the {@link EffectComposer} changes.

name: initialize
description:

This method is called when this pass is added to an {@link EffectComposer}.

params.name: alpha

name: dispose
description:
Performs a shallow search for disposable properties and deletes them.

The {@link EffectComposer} calls this method when it is being destroyed. You can use it independently to free
memory when you're certain that you don't need this pass anymore.

content:
# Post Processing

[![CI](https://github.com/pmndrs/postprocessing/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/pmndrs/postprocessing/actions/workflows/ci.yml)
[![Version](https://badgen.net/npm/v/postprocessing?color=green)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/postprocessing)

A post processing library for [three.js](https://threejs.org/).

*[Demo](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo) · [Sandbox](https://stackblitz.com/edit/postprocessing-v6) · [Documentation](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/docs) · [Wiki](https://github.com/pmndrs/postprocessing/wiki)*

## Installation

This library requires the peer dependency [three](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/).

```sh
npm install three postprocessing
```

## Usage

Post processing introduces the concept of passes and effects to extend the common rendering workflow with fullscreen image manipulation tools. The following WebGL attributes should be used for an optimal post processing workflow:

```js
import { WebGLRenderer } from "three";

const renderer = new WebGLRenderer({
	powerPreference: "high-performance",
	antialias: false,
	stencil: false,
	depth: false
});
```

The [EffectComposer](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/docs/class/src/core/EffectComposer.js~EffectComposer.html) manages and runs passes. It is common practice to use a [RenderPass](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/docs/class/src/passes/RenderPass.js~RenderPass.html) as the first pass to automatically clear the buffers and render a scene for further processing. Fullscreen image effects are rendered via the [EffectPass](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/docs/class/src/passes/EffectPass.js~EffectPass.html). Please refer to the [usage example](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/master/README.md) of three.js for more information on how to setup the renderer, scene and camera.

```js
import { BloomEffect, EffectComposer, EffectPass, RenderPass } from "postprocessing";

const composer = new EffectComposer(renderer);
composer.addPass(new RenderPass(scene, camera));
composer.addPass(new EffectPass(camera, new BloomEffect()));

requestAnimationFrame(function render() {

	requestAnimationFrame(render);
	composer.render();

});
```

## Output Color Space

New applications should follow a [linear workflow](https://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/LinearRendering-LinearOrGammaWorkflow.html) for color management and postprocessing supports this automatically. Simply set `WebGLRenderer.outputColorSpace` to `SRGBColorSpace` and postprocessing will follow suit.

Postprocessing uses `UnsignedByteType` sRGB frame buffers to store intermediate results. This is a trade-off between hardware support, efficiency and quality since linear results normally require at least 12 bits per color channel to prevent [color degradation and banding](https://blog.demofox.org/2018/03/10/dont-convert-srgb-u8-to-linear-u8/). With low precision sRGB buffers, colors will be clamped to `[0.0, 1.0]` and information loss will shift to the darker spectrum which leads to noticable banding in dark scenes. Linear, high precision `HalfFloatType` buffers don't have these issues and are the preferred option for HDR-like workflows on desktop devices. You can enable high precision frame buffers as follows:

```ts
import { HalfFloatType } from "three";

const composer = new EffectComposer(renderer, {
	frameBufferType: HalfFloatType
});
```

## Tone Mapping

Tone mapping is the process of converting HDR colors to LDR output colors. When using postprocessing, the `toneMapping` setting on the renderer should be set to `NoToneMapping` (default) and high precision frame buffers should be enabled. Otherwise, colors will be mapped to `[0.0, 1.0]` at the start of the pipeline. To enable tone mapping, use a `ToneMappingEffect` at the end of the pipeline.

Note that tone mapping is not applied to the clear color when using only the renderer because clearing doesn't involve shaders. Postprocessing applies to the full input image which means that tone mapping will also be applied uniformly. Consequently, the results of tone mapping a clear color background with and without postprocessing will be different, with the postprocessing approach being correct.

## Performance

This library provides an [EffectPass](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/docs/class/src/passes/EffectPass.js~EffectPass.html) which automatically organizes and merges any given combination of effects. This minimizes the amount of render operations and makes it possible to combine many effects without the performance penalties of traditional pass chaining. Additionally, every effect can choose its own [blend function](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/docs/variable/index.html#static-variable-BlendFunction).

All fullscreen render operations also use a [single triangle](https://michaldrobot.com/2014/04/01/gcn-execution-patterns-in-full-screen-passes/) that fills the screen. Compared to using a quad, this approach harmonizes with modern GPU rasterization patterns and eliminates unnecessary fragment calculations along the screen diagonal. This is especially beneficial for GPGPU passes and effects that use complex fragment shaders.

[Performance Test](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#performance)

## Included Effects

_The total demo download size is about `60 MB`._

 - [Antialiasing](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#antialiasing)
 - [Bloom](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#bloom)
 - [Blur](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#blur)
 - [Color Depth](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#color-depth)
 - [Color Grading](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#color-grading)
   - Color Average
   - Sepia
   - Brightness & Contrast
   - Hue & Saturation
   - LUT
 - [Depth of Field](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#depth-of-field)
   - Vignette
 - [Glitch](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#glitch)
   - Chromatic Aberration
   - Noise
 - [God Rays](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#god-rays)
 - [Pattern](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#pattern)
   - Dot-Screen
   - Grid
   - Scanline
 - [Pixelation](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#pixelation)
 - [Outline](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#outline)
 - [Shock Wave](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#shock-wave)
   - Depth Picking
 - [SSAO](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#ssao)
 - [Texture](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#texture)
 - [Tone Mapping](https://pmndrs.github.io/postprocessing/public/demo/#tone-mapping)

## Custom Effects

If you want to learn how to create custom effects or passes, please check the [Wiki](https://github.com/pmndrs/postprocessing/wiki).

## Contributing

Please refer to the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/pmndrs/postprocessing/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) for details.

## License

This library is licensed under the [Zlib license](https://github.com/pmndrs/postprocessing/blob/main/LICENSE.md).

The original code that this library is based on, was written by [mrdoob](https://mrdoob.com) and the [three.js contributors](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/graphs/contributors) and is licensed under the [MIT license](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/master/LICENSE).

{
	"name": "postprocessing",
	"version": "6.37.6",
	"description": "A post processing library for three.js.",
	"homepage": "https://github.com/pmndrs/postprocessing",
	"license": "Zlib",
	"type": "module",
	"sideEffects": false,
	"main": "./build/index.cjs",
	"module": "./build/index.js",
	"types": "./build/types/index.d.cts",
	"exports": {
		".": {
			"import": {
				"types": "./build/types/index.d.ts",
				"default": "./build/index.js"
			},
			"require": {
				"types": "./build/types/index.d.cts",
				"default": "./build/index.cjs"
			}
		}
	},
	"keywords": [
		"rendering",
		"image",
		"filter",
		"effect",
		"composer",
		"pass",
		"post",

		"gpgpu",

		"rendertexture",

		"three"
	],
	"author": {
		"name": "Raoul van Rüschen",
		"email": "vanruesc@outlook.de"
	},
	"repository": {
		"url": "git+https://github.com/pmndrs/postprocessing.git"
	},
	"bugs": {
		"url": "https://github.com/pmndrs/postprocessing/issues"
	},
	"files": [
		"./build"
	],
	"ava": {
		"failFast": true,
		"files": [
			"./test/**/*"
		]
	},
	"pnpm": {
		"onlyBuiltDependencies": [
			"@parcel/watcher",
			"core-js",
			"esbuild",
			"hugo-bin"
		]
	},
	"scripts": {
		"ava": "ava",
		"build": "npm run clean && run-p build:css build:js:min build:dts",
		"build:css": "sass --no-source-map -I manual/assets/css/src/values manual/assets/css/src:manual/assets/css/dist",
		"build:js": "node esbuild",
		"build:js:min": "node esbuild -m",
		"build:dts": "cpy \"types/*\" build/types && cpy \"types/*\" build/types --rename=index.d.cts",
		"clean": "del-cli build temp manual/resources \"manual/assets/**/dist\" public",
		"copy": "cpy \"demo/static/**/*\" public/demo",
		"deploy": "run-s copy postcss hugo gzip",
		"doc": "esdoc",
		"gzip": "gzipper c \"public\"",
		"hugo": "hugo -s manual --minify",
		"lint": "run-p lint:*",
		"lint:css": "stylelint --fix manual/assets/css/src",
		"lint:js": "eslint --fix src demo/src manual/assets/js/src",
		"lint:dts": "tsc types/index.d.ts --noEmit",
		"postcss": "postcss manual/assets/css/dist/index.css -o manual/assets/css/dist/index.css -c manual",
		"prepublishOnly": "npm test",
		"prewatch": "run-s clean copy build:css build:js",
		"test": "run-s lint build ava doc",
		"start": "hugo server -s manual -e development",
		"watch": "run-p watch:* start",
		"watch:css": "sass --no-source-map -I manual/assets/css/src/values manual/assets/css/src:manual/assets/css/dist -w",
		"watch:js": "node esbuild -w"
	},
	"peerDependencies": {
		"three": ">= 0.157.0 < 0.179.0"
	},
	"devDependencies": {
		"@tweakpane/core": "2.x.x",
		"@types/node": "24.x.x",
		"@types/three": "0.x.x",
		"@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin": "8.x.x",
		"@typescript-eslint/parser": "8.x.x",
		"autoprefixer": "10.x.x",
		"ava": "6.x.x",
		"cpy-cli": "5.x.x",
		"cssnano": "7.x.x",
		"dat.gui": "0.x.x",
		"del-cli": "6.x.x",
		"esbuild": "0.25.x",
		"esbuild-plugin-glsl": "1.x.x",
		"esdoc": "1.x.x",
		"esdoc-importpath-plugin": "1.x.x",
		"esdoc-standard-plugin": "1.x.x",
		"eslint": "9.x.x",
		"eslint-config-aether": "2.x.x",
		"gzipper": "8.x.x",
		"hugo-bin": "0.x.x",
		"npm-run-all": "4.x.x",
		"postcss": "8.x.x",
		"postcss-cli": "11.x.x",
		"postcss-preset-env": "10.x.x",
		"sass": "1.x.x",
		"spatial-controls": "6.x.x",
		"stylelint": "16.x.x",

		"stylelint-order": "7.x.x",
		"three": "0.x.x",
		"three-demo": "5.x.x",
		"tiny-glob": "0.x.x",
		"tslib": "2.x.x",
		"tweakpane": "4.x.x",
		"typescript": "5.8.x"
	}
